intro: Orthosiphon stenophyllus, commonly known as Java tea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, pale blue or white flowers arranged in whorls along the stem. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties. Orthosiphon stenophyllus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
